pages.text: Grapes come from Grape Vines grown from Grape Seeds on Farmland or Fertile Soil. Obtain Grape Seeds by breaking vines. Grape Seeds grow into Grape Vines when supported by a horizontal Rope above them. Vines spread one block along the Rope and produce Grapes. The outer vines grow grapes as long as there is air below the vines.

Harvest Grapes by breaking or interacting with the Grape Vines. Picking the Grapes from the vine is the most efficient way to harvest as it does not break the vine. In addition, grapes take half as long to eat as regular foods.
